title: What does Allied Science mean, for what is it actually? - Quora

response.answer_text: Allied sciences is a type of medical discipline. There are various courses for allied sciences like B. Sc. In Medical Laboratory Science, Radiologic Sciences, and Respiratory Care, to name a few. A person taking this course (or having a master's in allied sciences) is either a radiologist or a medical laboratory scientist. The principle areas of practice in allied sciences are chemistry, hematology, microbiology, urinalysis, immunohematology and immunology, along with the technical expertise on how to operate various medical technologies.
